title: How to use exportModule
text: scissor’s exportModule export (download) inputData, transformed scissor’s functions. article, ’ll use scholarship dataset datatoys article based 0.2.0 Version scissor

title: How to use exportModule
text: scissor’s module assumes used Shiny application. can use snippet(type shinyapp) build basic shiny application. application show nothing. let’s add exportModule ui. also, exportModule server. final (basic) code like . notice 3 things. id ui server . inputData server format reactive
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    }  shinyApp(ui, server) ui <- fluidPage(   mod_exportModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) ) server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_exportModule_server(     id = "module",      inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship)   ) } library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   mod_exportModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_exportModule_server(     id = "module",      inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship) # remotes::install_github('statgarten/datatoys')   )   }  shinyApp(ui, server) # run application

title: How to use exportModule
text: exportModule consisted Control Area using flow. Declare module (already) select output format filename (like ‘download.csv’) Export

title: How to use reorderModule
text: scissor’s reorderModule shows change order column using sortable article, ’ll use scholarship dataset datatoys article based 0.2.0 Version scissor

title: How to use reorderModule
text: scissor’s module assumes used Shiny application. can use snippet(type shinyapp) build basic shiny application. application show nothing. let’s add `reorderModule`` ui. also, reorderModule server. final (basic) code like . notice 3 things. id ui server . inputData server format reactive Module’s reorder effect inputData yet
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    }  shinyApp(ui, server) ui <- fluidPage(   mod_reorderModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) ) server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_reorderModule_server(     id = "module",     inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship)    ) } library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   mod_distributionModule_ui(     id = 'distModule'   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_reorderModule_server(     id = "module",     inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship)  # remotes::install_github('statgarten/datatoys')   ) }  shinyApp(ui, server) # run application

title: How to use reorderModule
text: reorderModule consisted Control Area using flow. Declare module (already) Drag drop column reorder Apply (declare additional Action button)

title: How to use reorderModule
text: Let’s add action button table (view data) like . run can see image like .  make change order column apply, can see result table.  issue suggestion, please make issue scissor’s github.
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   reactable::reactableOutput('table'),      mod_reorderModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ),   actionButton(     inputId = "applyReorder",      label = 'reorder'   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {      # Data link   inputData <- reactiveVal(NULL)   inputData(datatoys::scholarship)   data_rv <- reactiveValues(data = NULL)      observeEvent(inputData(), {     data_rv$data <- inputData()   })      # Data View   output$table <- reactable::renderReactable({     reactable::reactable(data_rv$data)   })         # Reorder Module   res_reorder <- mod_reorderModule_server(     id = "module",     inputData = reactive(data_rv$data)   )      # Apply    observeEvent(input$applyReorder, {     data_rv$data <- res_reorder() # reactive     inputData(data_rv$data) # then use isolated    })    }  shinyApp(ui, server) # run application

title: How to use transformModule
text: similar modules transform data. list . Binarize ETC Log Replace Round Split article, call transformModule. scissor’s transformModule transforms selected variables. article, ’ll use scholarship dataset datatoys article based 0.2.0 Version scissor.

title: How to use transformModule
text: scissor’s module assumes used Shiny application. can use snippet(type shinyapp) build basic shiny application. application show nothing. let’s add binarizeModule ui also, binarizeModule server. final (basic) code like . notice 3 things. id ui server . inputData server format reactive exampple may declare module, work.
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    }  shinyApp(ui, server) ui <- fluidPage(   mod_binarizeModule_ui(     id = 'binModule'   ) ) server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_binarizeModule_server(     id = 'binModule',      inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship)   ) } library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   mod_binarizeModule_ui(     id = 'binModule'   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_binarizeModule_server(     id = 'binModule',      inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship) # remotes::install_github('statgarten/datatoys')   ) }  shinyApp(ui, server) # run application

title: How to use transformModule
text: mentioned, modules, let’s add ETCModule ui server three big problems. module’s UI simultaneously added . (looks bad) module’s transform independent. , even binModule change column , etcModule recognize . Module’s transform effect inputData ’s one usage door utilize scissor module.  Note , module consist layout may change user’s goal. However, strongly recommend utilize modules tabsetpanel modal finally, Action button transform must added (included module now. consider update version)
code: ui <- fluidPage(   mod_binarizeModule_ui(     id = 'binModule'   ),      mod_etcModule_ui(     id = 'etcModule'   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_binarizeModule_server(     id = 'binModule',      inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship) # remotes::install_github('statgarten/datatoys')   )      mod_etcModule_server(     id = 'etcModule',      inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship)    ) }  shinyApp(ui, server) # run application library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   reactable::reactableOutput('table'), # view data      tabsetPanel( # Modules as tabset     id = "transformPanel",     tabPanel(       title = "Round",       mod_roundModule_ui("roundModule_1")     ),     tabPanel( # Log2 / Log / Log10       title = "Log",       mod_logModule_ui("logModule_1")     ),     tabPanel(       title = "Replace",       mod_replaceModule_ui("replaceModule_1")     ),     tabPanel(       title = "ETC",       mod_etcModule_ui("etcModule_1")     ),     tabPanel(       title = "Binarize",       mod_binarizeModule_ui("binModule_1")     ),     tabPanel(       title = "Split",       mod_splitModule_ui(id = "splitModule_1")     )   ),   actionButton( # actionbutton to apply transform     inputId = "applyTransform",     label = tagList(       phosphoricons::ph("arrow-circle-right"),       "Apply changes"     ),     width = "100%"   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {      # Data handling   inputData <- reactive(datatoys::scholarship)   data_rv <- reactiveValues(data = NULL)      observeEvent(inputData(), {     data_rv$data <- inputData()   })      # Data view   output$table <- reactable::renderReactable({     reactable::reactable(data_rv$data)   })         # Data transform   res_round <- mod_roundModule_server(     id = "roundModule_1",     inputData = reactive(data_rv$data)   )      ## log Module      res_log <- mod_logModule_server(     id = "logModule_1",     inputData = reactive(data_rv$data)   )      ## replace Module      res_replace <- mod_replaceModule_server(     id = "replaceModule_1",     inputData = reactive(data_rv$data)   )      ## binarize Module      res_binary <- mod_binarizeModule_server(     id = "binModule_1",     inputData = reactive(data_rv$data)   )      ## etc Module      res_trans <- mod_etcModule_server(     id = "etcModule_1",     inputData = reactive(data_rv$data)   )      ## Split Module      res_split <- mod_splitModule_server(     id = "splitModule_1",     inputData = reactive(data_rv$data)   )      # update data   observeEvent(input$applyTransform, {     if (input$transformPanel == "Round") {       data_rv$data <- res_round()     }     if (input$transformPanel == "Log") {       data_rv$data <- res_log()     }     if (input$transformPanel == "Replace") {       data_rv$data <- res_replace()     }     if (input$transformPanel == "Binarize") {       data_rv$data <- res_binary()     }     if (input$transformPanel == "ETC") {       data_rv$data <- res_trans()     }          if (input$transformPanel == "Split") {       data_rv$data <- res_split()     }          inputData(data_rv$data) # then use isolated   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server) # run application

title: How to use transformModule
text: transformModule consisted Control Area Description Area (Result Area) Description area explains expected transform result example control options. using flow. Declare module (already) Select function column transform, apply button Finish (result linked view like table) issue suggestion, please make issue scissor’s github.
